desc: A group of MSU students are looking for an artist to draw animated segments as a supplement to video in our short film, Standing Up. We would love to have a comic book esq. styled animation with no more than 5 frames a second for roughly, and also no more than, 1 minute and 40 seconds. Time is negotiable. Not looking for crazy backgrounds, crazy colors, just cool drawings to supplement our video and allow us more freedom with re-recording audio tracks etc. I don't know how to use the correct animation lingo, but we are envisioning still drawings, quickly-ish cut together to mimic animation.The drawings can be as crazy as you want, referencing our main characters love for accounting, his looming, overbearing mother, his dead dad, him on stage, getting tomatoes thrown at him, etc.We also need this done by Tuesday, December 12. We understand that is a huge rush, but we are at a crossroads with our project and need to get it done.I have a rough cut finished right now of the video that would be inter spliced with the animation and if that is something that would help you get the picture of what we are saying please let me know!
title: Standing Up - Short Film

desc: I am a long time journalist that is delving into the world of children's books after an inspirational point of time in my life involving my young daughter.  I plan to pre-sell the book through crowdfunding before ultimately seeking out a publisher.  This project is very simple, yet unique and would be a great project for any aspiring or established artist.  I am looking for a 50-50 partner that can illustrate my vision with 10% of all proceeds going to benefit the Save the Next Girl Foundation.  The winner of this contest will be that partner.  For the contest I will need three depictions from different pages in the book.  The winner will then be required to partner with me to illustrate the book, which will be used to produce the crowdfunding video.  This project deals with the last time a parent sees their child and is meant to help parents understand the fragility of life.  The Save the Next Girl Foundation is a Virginia-based non-profit that educates people, especially young women, about their surroundings and ways to stay safe.  The foundation was founded after the kidnapping and murder of Virginia Tech student, Morgan Harrington.  While this contest does not award a winner in direct cash, I will enter a legal contract to assure the winner a 45% share of any profit realized in its sale.
title: Children's Book
